response.answer_text: Xanax is a trade name for Alprazolam, that is benzodiazepine. Benzodiazepines are generally produced by condensation of o-phenylenediamine using acidic catalyst. The by-product powder then formed is made to pills. Each Xanax Tablet, for oral administration, contains 0.25, 0.5, 1 or 2 mg of alprazolam. Alprazolam is used to treat anxiety and panic disorders. It belongs to benzodiazepines which act on the brain and nerves to produce a calming effect. Xanax Tablets are indicated for the management of anxiety disorder.
